meanings.definition: A small cabinet or box for holding bottles of wine or liquor.
meanings.sent1: The cellarette in the dining room is where we keep our wine bottles.
meanings.sent2: She placed the new bottle of wine in the cellarette to keep it cool.
meanings.sent3: The cellarette was so full of bottles that it looked like a tiny wine store!
meanings.sent4: Her collection of wine bottles in the cellarette was a treasure trove waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The cellarette, with its shiny door and neatly arranged bottles, was a charming addition to the room.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture used for storing alcoholic beverages.
meanings.sent1: The antique cellarette in the corner held a variety of spirits.
meanings.sent2: He admired the craftsmanship of the cellarette that displayed his liquor collection.
meanings.sent3: The cellarette seemed to be whispering, 'Pick your poison!' as he approached it.
meanings.sent4: The cellarette stood like a faithful guardian, protecting its precious contents.
meanings.sent5: Every evening, he would open the cellarette and choose a drink to unwind.

meanings.definition: A container for storing and serving drinks.
meanings.sent1: The elegant cellarette on the table held an assortment of beverages for the guests.
meanings.sent2: She poured a glass of wine from the cellarette to accompany the meal.
meanings.sent3: The cellarette was like a magic box, producing drinks with a wave of the hand.
meanings.sent4: As the party started, the cellarette became the center of attention, offering refreshments to all.
meanings.sent5: The cellarette gleamed in the candlelight, beckoning guests to enjoy its contents.
